body.para: I am using Saxon to do my XSLT. I am doing conversions with XSLT from the shell in Linux.
Then the output is printed in the shell. This is ok and exactly what I want.
But now I need to generate the stylesheet dynamically. I could create temporary XSL files, but this is not efficient and may cause conflicts if multiple users are doing the same at the same time.
Is there a way to do a conversion with Saxon in the shell by replacing "style.xsl" with its actual content?
$ java -cp saxon9.jar net.sf.saxon.Transform data.xml `echo 'actual content of stylesheet'`
Btw, this is not working, but I hope my idea is clear.
